author: Cavan Sieczkowski
title: Tom Hiddleston Swears Taylor Swift Romance Was Legit
text:
Tom Hiddleston Swears Taylor Swift Romance Was Legit "Of course it was real." 02/08/2017 10:26 am ET Cavan Sieczkowski Deputy Director, News & Analytics 
Hiddleswift might have only lasted three short months, but Tom Hiddleston swears it was the real deal. 
The actor appears on the March cover of GQ magazine. In his cover story interview, he broached the subject of his romance with Taylor Swift . 
â€œTaylor is an amazing woman. Sheâ€™s generous and kind and lovely, and we had the best time,â€ he said, failing to address the actual question of whether or not the coupling was destiny or a publicity stunt . â€œOf course it was real,â€ he insisted. 
As for that â€œI Heart TSâ€ tank top he wore during the â€œOut of the Woodsâ€ singerâ€™s Fourth of July bash at her Rhode Island mansion, Hiddleston said it wasnâ€™t even his. ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ A photo posted by Britany LaManna (@britmaack) on Jul 5, 2016 at 12:11pm PDT 
â€œThe truth is, it was the Fourth of July and a public holiday and we were playing a game and I slipped and hurt my back,â€ he told GQ. â€œAnd I wanted to protect the graze from the sun and said, â€™Does anyone have a T-shirt?â€™ And one of her friends said, â€™Iâ€™ve got this.â€™ And we all laughed about it. It was a joke.â€ 
He wants to be excluded from the false narratives surrounding the TS top. 
â€œA relationship exists between two people,â€ he said. â€œWe will always know what it was. The narratives that are out there altogether have been extrapolated from pictures that were taken without consent or permission, with no context. Nobody had the context for that story. And Iâ€™m still trying to work out a way of having a personal life and protecting it, but also without hiding. So the hardest thing is that that was a joke among friends on the Fourth of July.â€ 
Lena Dunham recently defended her friendâ€™s relationships during an interview with Howard Stern for his SiriusXM show Monday, saying that dating in the public eye is never easy, especially for a young woman. 
â€œNot to repeat age-old feminist points, but itâ€™s like, you know, any male actor her age whoâ€™s going out and dating is applauded, and to just have a perfectly normal amount of romantic partners but be held to impossibly high standards by the press,â€ Dunham told Stern, â€œlike, itâ€™s just an unfair and unwinnable game.â€ Also on HuffPost
